snippet: Malaysia Airlines said Saturday morning that it had lost contact five hours earlier with a flight carrying at least 239 people to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur, and had activated a search-and-rescue team.
abstract: Malaysia Airlines says it has lost contact with a flight carrying at least 239 people to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur, and has activated a search-and-rescue team.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Chris Buckley from Hong Kong, Bree Feng and Amy Qin from Beijing, and Matthew L. Wald from the United States.

lead_paragraph: Malaysia Airlines said Saturday morning that it had lost contact five hours earlier with a flight carrying at least 239 people to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur, and had activated a search-and-rescue team.

headline.main: Malaysia Airlines Loses Contact With Jet Carrying Over 200
headline.print_headline: Malaysia Airlines Says It Lost Contact With Jet Taking Over 200 to Beijing
